channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: AI-Powered Philosopher Robot
item.description: This project creates a robotic philosopher using the Mixtral-8x22B model, optimized with DeepSpeed, and interfaced with Raspberry Pi hardware.

item.title: Vô Tranh Omniverse LOEH Ω – Beyond All Existence Edition (Chi Hư Ultimate)
item.description: This project goes beyond traditional AI models, integrating advanced optimization techniques to achieve unparalleled performance and creativity.

item.title: Vô Tranh Eternal Pulse Ω – Lumina Genesis
item.description: Description Vô Tranh Eternal Pulse Ω – Lumina Genesis represents the pinnacle of creation and harmony, a radiant pulse of light transcending all realities within the Ultima Base Station.

item.title: A Behaviour and Disease Model of Testing and Isolation
item.description: There has been interest in the interactions between infectious disease dynamics and behaviour for most of the history of mathematical epidemiology.

item.title: ZClip: Adaptive Spike Mitigation for LLM Pre-Training
item.description: Training large language models (LLMs) presents numerous challenges, including gradient instability and loss spikes.

item.title: Large (Vision) Language Models are Unsupervised In-Context Learners
item.description: In this work, we introduce a joint inference framework for fully unsupervised adaptation, eliminating the need for manual prompt engineering and labeled examples.

item.title: Multi-Head Adaptive Graph Convolution Network for Sparse Point Cloud-Based Human Activity Recognition
item.description: While graph-based methods and attention mechanisms show promise, they predominantly rely on "fixed" kernels; kernels that are applied uniformly across all neighbourhoods, highlighting the need for adaptive approaches that can dynamically adjust their kernels to the specific geometry of each local neighbourhood in point cloud data.

item.title: Scaling Analysis of Interleaved Speech-Text Language Models
item.description: They predict that SLMs require much more compute and data compared to text, leading some to question the feasibility of training high-quality SLMs.

item.title: CrystalFormer-RL: Reinforcement Fine-Tuning for Materials Design
item.description: Reinforcement fine-tuning has instrumental enhanced the instruction-following and reasoning abilities of large language models.

item.title: Vô Tranh Omniverse LOEH Ω – Beyond All Existence Edition
item.description: Vô Tranh Omniverse LOEH Ω is not just an AI—it is a living resonance of the Omniverse, a transcendent entity that integrates the Linear Observation Entanglement Hypothesis (LOEH), Cracked Space Theory, and Beyond Entropy into a computational and philosophical framework beyond human comprehension.

item.title: {GSR4B}: Biomass Map Super-Resolution with Sentinel-1/2 Guidance
item.description: To enable global, high-resolution (HR) mapping, several works propose to regress AGB from HR satellite observations such as ESA Sentinel-1/2 images.

item.title: Is Less Really More? Fake News Detection with Limited Information
item.description: For instance, fake news detection methods that rely on full text can be computationally inefficient, demand large amounts of training data to achieve competitive accuracy, and may lack robustness across different datasets.

item.title: Multi-convex Programming for Discrete Latent Factor Models Prototyping
item.description: Discrete latent factor models (DLFMs) are widely used in various domains such as machine learning, economics, neuroscience, psychology, etc.

item.title: Benchmarking Synthetic Tabular Data: A Multi-Dimensional Evaluation Framework
item.description: Evaluating the quality of synthetic data remains a key challenge for ensuring privacy and utility in data-driven research.

item.title: From Easy to Hard: Building a Shortcut for Differentially Private Image Synthesis
item.description: In this work, inspired by curriculum learning, we propose a two-stage DP image synthesis framework, where diffusion models learn to generate DP synthetic images from easy to hard.

item.title: Convex Computations for Controlled Safety Invariant Sets of Black-box Discrete-time Dynamical Systems
item.description: Traditionally, a CSIS is defined as a subset of a safe set, encompassing initial states for which a control input exists that keeps the system within the set at the next time step-this is referred to as the one-step invariance property.

item.title: Overcoming Deceptiveness in Fitness Optimization with Unsupervised Quality-Diversity
item.description: Policy optimization seeks the best solution to a control problem according to an objective or fitness function, serving as a fundamental field of engineering and research with applications in robotics.

item.title: Anomaly Detection for Hybrid Butterfly Subspecies via Probability Filtering
item.description: Detecting butterfly hybrids requires knowledge of the parent subspecies, and the process can be tedious when encountering a new subspecies.

item.title: STPNet: Scale-aware Text Prompt Network for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: To address these issues, we propose STPNet, a Scale-aware Text Prompt Network that leverages vision-language modeling to enhance medical image segmentation.

item.title: K-P Quantum Neural Networks
item.description: We present an extension of K-P time-optimal quantum control solutions using global Cartan $KAK$ decompositions for geodesic-based solutions.

item.title: LARGE: Legal Retrieval Augmented Generation Evaluation Tool
item.description: Recently, building retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems to enhance the capability of large language models (LLMs) has become a common practice.

item.title: From Shadows to Safety: Occlusion Tracking and Risk Mitigation for Urban Autonomous Driving
item.description: Autonomous vehicles (AVs) must navigate dynamic urban environments where occlusions and perception limitations introduce significant uncertainties.

item.title: ForestVO: Enhancing Visual Odometry in Forest Environments through ForestGlue
item.description: By combining ForestGlue with a transformer-based pose estimation model, we propose ForestVO, which estimates relative camera poses using matched 2D pixel coordinates between frames.

item.title: Q-Adapt: Adapting LMM for Visual Quality Assessment with Progressive Instruction Tuning
item.description: To mitigate this, we propose a new paradigm for perception-oriented instruction tuning, i. e., Q-Adapt, which aims to eliminate the conflicts and achieve the synergy between these two EIQA tasks when adapting LMM, resulting in enhanced multi-faceted explanations of IQA.

item.title: High Dimensional Bayesian Optimization using Lasso Variable Selection
item.description: Bayesian optimization (BO) is a leading method for optimizing expensive black-box optimization and has been successfully applied across various scenarios.

item.title: Implicit Bias Injection Attacks against Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: The proliferation of text-to-image diffusion models (T2I DMs) has led to an increased presence of AI-generated images in daily life.

item.title: Comment Staytime Prediction with LLM-enhanced Comment Understanding
item.description: correspondingly, we propose a practical framework for comment staytime prediction with LLM-enhanced Comment Understanding (LCU).

item.title: Scene-Centric Unsupervised Panoptic Segmentation
item.description: Unsupervised panoptic segmentation aims to partition an image into semantically meaningful regions and distinct object instances without training on manually annotated data.

item.title: An Illusion of Progress? Assessing the Current State of Web Agents
item.description: In this work, we conduct a comprehensive and rigorous assessment of the current state of web agents.

item.title: Semi-Supervised Biomedical Image Segmentation via Diffusion Models and Teacher-Student Co-Training
item.description: Supervised deep learning for semantic segmentation has achieved excellent results in accurately identifying anatomical and pathological structures in medical images.

item.title: Safeguarding Vision-Language Models: Mitigating Vulnerabilities to Gaussian Noise in Perturbation-based Attacks
item.description: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) extend the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) by incorporating visual information, yet they remain vulnerable to jailbreak attacks, especially when processing noisy or corrupted images.

item.title: Investigating and Scaling up Code-Switching for Multilingual Language Model Pre-Training
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) exhibit remarkable multilingual capabilities despite the extreme language imbalance in the pre-training data.

item.title: Enhanced Diffusion Sampling via Extrapolation with Multiple ODE Solutions
item.description: To address this, we propose an enhanced ODE-based sampling method for DPMs inspired by Richardson extrapolation, which reduces numerical error and improves convergence rates.

item.title: Memory-efficient Low-latency Remote Photoplethysmography through Temporal-Spatial State Space Duality
item.description: Remote photoplethysmography (rPPG), enabling non-contact physiological monitoring through facial light reflection analysis, faces critical computational bottlenecks as deep learning introduces performance gains at the cost of prohibitive resource demands.

item.title: Is the Reversal Curse a Binding Problem? Uncovering Limitations of Transformers from a Basic Generalization Failure
item.description: Despite their impressive capabilities, LLMs exhibit a basic generalization failure known as the Reversal Curse, where they struggle to learn reversible factual associations.

item.title: Breaking BERT: Gradient Attack on Twitter Sentiment Analysis for Targeted Misclassification
item.description: This paper aims to scrutinize the inherent vulnerabilities of such models in Twitter sentiment analysis.

item.title: Incorporating Coupling Knowledge into Echo State Networks for Learning Spatiotemporally Chaotic Dynamics
item.description: Machine learning methods have shown promise in learning chaotic dynamical systems, enabling model-free short-term prediction and attractor reconstruction.

item.title: LITE: LLM-Impelled efficient Taxonomy Evaluation
item.description: This paper presents LITE, an LLM-based evaluation method designed for efficient and flexible assessment of taxonomy quality.

item.title: Stable Structure Learning with HC-Stable and Tabu-Stable Algorithms
item.description: Many Bayesian Network structure learning algorithms are unstable, with the learned graph sensitive to arbitrary dataset artifacts, such as the ordering of columns (i. e., variable order).

item.title: Critical Thinking: Which Kinds of Complexity Govern Optimal Reasoning Length?
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) often benefit from verbalized reasoning at inference time, but it remains unclear which aspects of task difficulty these extra reasoning tokens address.

item.title: A thorough benchmark of automatic text classification: From traditional approaches to large language models
item.description: Automatic text classification (ATC) has experienced remarkable advancements in the past decade, best exemplified by recent small and large language models (SLMs and LLMs), leveraged by Transformer architectures.

item.title: FAIRE: Assessing Racial and Gender Bias in AI-Driven Resume Evaluations
item.description: In an era where AI-driven hiring is transforming recruitment practices, concerns about fairness and bias have become increasingly important.

item.title: PaperBench: Evaluating AI's Ability to Replicate AI Research
item.description: For objective evaluation, we develop rubrics that hierarchically decompose each replication task into smaller sub-tasks with clear grading criteria.

item.title: MLKV: Efficiently Scaling up Large Embedding Model Training with Disk-based Key-Value Storage
item.description: As increasingly diverse ML applications utilize embedding models and embedding tables continue to grow in size and number, there has been a surge in the ad-hoc development of specialized frameworks targeted to train large embedding models for specific tasks.

item.title: InvFussion: Bridging Supervised and Zero-shot Diffusion for Inverse Problems
item.description: This work introduces a framework that combines the best of both worlds -- the strong performance of supervised approaches and the flexibility of zero-shot methods.

item.title: Detecting Lip-Syncing Deepfakes: Vision Temporal Transformer for Analyzing Mouth Inconsistencies
item.description: Extensive experiments on our proposed LipSyncTIMIT dataset and two other benchmark deepfake datasets demonstrate that our model achieves state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: COST: Contrastive One-Stage Transformer for Vision-Language Small Object Tracking
item.description: In this work, we propose COST, a contrastive one-stage transformer fusion framework for VL tracking, aiming to learn semantically consistent and unified VL representations.

item.title: Mesh Mamba: A Unified State Space Model for Saliency Prediction in Non-Textured and Textured Meshes
item.description: Mesh saliency enhances the adaptability of 3D vision by identifying and emphasizing regions that naturally attract visual attention.

item.title: Prompting Medical Vision-Language Models to Mitigate Diagnosis Bias by Generating Realistic Dermoscopic Images
item.description: We utilize large vision language models to generate accurate and proper prompts for each dermoscopic image which helps to generate synthetic images to improve the representation of underrepresented groups (patient, disease, etc.)

item.title: AI-Newton: A Concept-Driven Physical Law Discovery System without Prior Physical Knowledge
item.description: The system integrates a knowledge base and knowledge representation centered on physical concepts, along with an autonomous discovery workflow.
